greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference between prime factors of n-th semiprime.
comment: a(n)=0 iff sp(n) is a square of prime, sp(n) = n-th semiprime = A001358(n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000 (first 1000 terms from Zak Seidov)
example: a(1)=0 because sp(1)=4=2*2 and 2-2=0; a(2)=1 because sp(2)=6=2*3 and 3-2=1; sp(n)=n-th semiprime.
maple: with(numtheory): a:=proc(n) if bigomega(n)=2 and nops(factorset(n))=2 then factorset(n)[2]-factorset(n)[1] elif bigomega(n)=2 then 0 else fi end: seq(a(n),n=1..225); # _Emeric Deutsch_
b:= proc(n) option remember; local k;
else for k from 1+b(n-1) do if not isprime(k) and
results.author: _Zak Seidov_, Jun 27 2005
